body.p:
Cl Hickman Circuit Court
Coml
vs } To Gov Bramlette Feby 29th 1864
John Thos Stone &c

At this Feby time of this Court Ths Stone was fined on three indictments for retailing, all the acts complained of were at a Barbacue about 4th July, on Saturday, & I have fully investigated the outside facts & find Stone to be an old man & quite poor yet very respectable, but illirate poorly educated he was in attendance at a barbecue & a man there who had liquor to sell hired Stone to attend to it for a short time the old man supposing it to be a fair way to make an honest penny and break no law did it & was indicted he is not engaged regularly in any such business but is an honest, law abiding hard working man I feel no hestation in recommending his case to executive clemency

Your honor may rest assured I will never recommend any case for pardon that is not deserving & I will here say it is the only case from this term of this court which I regard as having merit in it -- I further say that executive clemency has heretofore in this district been so easy as to encourage crime & vice rather than break it up

P D Yeiser
Coml Atty
1st Judl. District
